persons.name: Tadius Ahern
persons.description: In charge of the Pinnacle Station (DLC) training center, Ahern is a veteran of the [First Contact War|https://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/First_Contact_War]. During Shepard's training, he provides sarcasm and a high bar for success. Also, after completing the DLC, Shepard can order rare weapons, armor, and upgrades from Ahern's personal computer on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Arg.Pho.Intaisei].

persons.name: Khalisah bint Sinan al-Jilani
persons.description: An abrasive and sensationalist reporter for Westerlund News. She ambushes Shepard in all three games for hostile interviews. If Shepard is not careful, all three end with her being punched in the face and the Alliance pissed off at Shepard for the bad press.

sideEffects: If Shepard headbutts al-Jilani (she dodges the first punch), she lies unconscious on the floor for the remainder of Shepard's visit to the Citadel.
During the Citadel (DLC) missions, Shepard can listen to al-Jilani's interview with Admiral Anderson in Anderson's apartment. Her name is also on the scoreboards for games on the Silversun Strip.
During Priority: The Citadel II, al-Jilani can be seen in the Executor's Office, broadcasting the C-Sec attack against the Comm towers and thereby attempting to notify any C-Sec reinforcements.

persons.name: Bel Anoleis
persons.description: The corrupt administrator of [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen], Anoleis represents the corporate executive board and has oversight of the businesses operating in the port.
sideEffects: Apparently his full name is Rannadril Ghan Swa Fulsoom Karaten Narr Eadi Bel Anoleis.

persons.name: Avina
persons.description: A virtual intelligence located at many locations on the Citadel, Avina can always give directions and provide historical background.

persons.name: Menos Avot
persons.description: Part of [Kirrahe's|megametracker://person?id=P1.Kirrahe] team on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Sen.Hoc.Virmire], Menos Avot was captured by [Saren|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren], who has been experimenting on the salarian prisoners with Reaper Indoctrination. He can be freed in [megametracker://mission?id=A1.T.VirmirePrisoners.1].

persons.name: Armisten Banes
persons.description: A mysterious figure, contracted by the Alliance according to [Dr. Michel|megametracker://person?id=O1.DrMichel], and possibly by Cerberus as revealed by hints dropped in various assignments, he is dead before Game 1 even starts. For more spoilers (but no real answers) read this: [Bioware Forums: Armistan Banes - A Persistant Mystery|https://fextralife.com/forums/t216399/armistan-banes--a-persistant-mystery/].

persons.name: Barla Von
persons.description: A financial advisor to the Citadel's elite, Barla Von supplements his shady business by trading information for the [Shadow Broker|megametracker://person?id=E2.ShadowBroker].

persons.name: Samesh Bhatia
persons.description: Bhatia lost his wife Nerali to the geth attack on Eden Prime and there is some difficulty when the Alliance retained the body for tests.
sideEffects: If Shepard secured the release of his wife's body in Game 1, Bhatia sends Shepard an email in Game 2, revealing that he has accomplished his wife's dream of opening a restaurant back on Earth where Alliance soldiers eat for free.

persons.name: Hollis Blake
persons.description: Hollis is tending to his sick wife, [Calantha|megametracker://person?id=BlakeC], who is exhibiting strange behavior on Feros.

persons.name: Calantha Blake
persons.description: Calantha is sick in the old freighter's medical bay at [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope]. She is being looked after by her husband, [megametracker://person?id=O1.BlakeH].

persons.name: Bosker
persons.description: Bosker is the clerk who was responsible for refusing to release Nirali Bhatia's body to her husband.

persons.name: Kate Bowman
persons.description: The source of a distress call to the Normandy from Asteroid X57, Kate is hiding there from Batarian terrorists. She is eventually discovered and taken hostage. Whether she lives or dies depends on Shepard's actions.
sideEffects: If you save the hostages, Kate will send you an e-mail thanking you in Game 2. She will also be mentioned in a newscast for giving a speech at the Terra Nova memorial. If the hostages die, a Reverend Bowman will hold a prayer session for them at that memorial.

persons.name: Martin Burns
persons.description: Head of the Alliance Parliamentary Subcommittee for Transhuman Studies, Burns voted against reparations for L2 biotics. The biotics kidnap him aboard the MSV Ontario, where Shepard can negotiate for his rescue with high enough Charm/Intimidate, or lose him to the bitotics during the attack.
sideEffects: If you save Burns, there is a news report that L2 biotics have received reparations and Burns will send you a thank you message in Game 2, for changing his mind on the L2s.

persons.name: Mallene Calis
persons.description: Calis was convinced [megametracker://person?id=O1.Vargas] of Binary Helix had stolen data from her company.

persons.name: Calyn
persons.description: Calyn shares an embassy with Din Korlack, the volus ambassador. He is accepting and friendly, often chastising the volus for being so angry with humans.

persons.name: Charn
persons.description: Not really part of [Balak's|megametracker://person?id=E1.Balak] crew, despite being his current second-in-command, Charn came to Asteroid X57 on a slave raid. He fears Balak will kill him if he does not follow orders, but he wants nothing to do with Balak's suicidal mission to destroy the human colony on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Exo.Asg.Terra].

persons.name: Decian Chellick
persons.description: Chellick is working for C-Sec to combat illegal arms trading on the Citadel.

persons.name: Chorban
persons.description: Partnered with [megametracker://person?id=O1.Jahleed], he is researching the Citadel keepers.

persons.name: Zev Cohen
persons.description:
Dr. Cohen's team at [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation] on Noveria was working on a biotoxin called Thoros-B. When Mira went offline, the scientists were infected with the toxin. Shepard can choose to help develop a cure for them.

Once Shepard is involved in fighting with any of the guards, Cohen and the other civilians refuse to interact with Shepard.

persons.name: Cole
persons.description: After the geth attacked [Spaceport|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Exo.Uto.Eden], Cole and two other farmers lock themselves inside a building. When Shepard decrypts the lock, they describe the attack and [megametracker://person?id=E1.Sovereign]. If pressed, Cole will reveal they are also part of a smuggling ring involving another party, [megametracker://person?id=O1.Powell], whom Shepard meets at the [Spaceport|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Exo.Uto.Ede.B].

persons.name: Dahlia Dantius
persons.description: Far from being the helpless kidnapping victim portrayed by her sister [megametracker://person?id=O1.DantiusN], Dahlia is a ruthless slaver and pirate.

persons.name: Nassana Dantius
persons.description: Usually found in the Embassy Lounge, Nassana asked for Shepard's help in rescuing her sister [megametracker://person?id=O1.DantiusD] from kidnappers, but this was all a ruse to eliminate Dahlia, who was blackmailing Nassana.

2.description:
Shepard first met Nassana in Game 1, when she recruited Shepard to "rescue" her sister Dahlia, knowing that Shepard would kill Dahlia instead. 

Nassana reappears in Game 2, hiding from an assassin in her penthouse on Illium, after having made one too many enemies.

persons.name: Lord Darius
persons.description: An arrogant warlord in control of Element Zero mining rights, he is hostile to Shepard's negotiations and demands outrageous concessions to sign over the rights.

persons.name: David al Talaqani
persons.description: A [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope] colonist, David is killed by geth soon after Shepard lands.
sideEffects: There are ways to prevent the geth from killing David (say, by laying mines before speaking with him).

persons.name: Delanynder "Delan"
persons.description: A merchant at the [megametracker://maplocation?id=G.C1.Presidium.Emporium&type=Map] on the Citadel. It sells serveral licenses and a medi-gel upgrade.

persons.name: Din Korlack
persons.description: The volus ambassador on the Citadel, Din Korlack carries a deep resentment towards humans.

3.description:
The volus ambassador on the Citadel, Din Korlack carries a deep resentment towards humans. 

He profited from deals with Cerberus, but cut ties with the group before the Reaper invasion. The turians, unaware of his changed loyalties, have put a bounty on his head.

persons.name: Doran
persons.description: The amiable owner of Flux and [Rita's|megametracker://person?id=O1.Rita] (and later [Jenna's|megametracker://person?id=O1.Jenna]) boss.
sideEffects: After finishing [megametracker://mission?id=A1.C1.SchellsTheGambler], Shepard can start a dance-off against Doran at Flux.

persons.name: Macha Doyle
persons.description: Macha Doyle is in charge of restoring water to the [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope] colony.

persons.name: Droyas
persons.description: Droyas and his asari assistant are experimenting on husks in a lab at [Saren's|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren] base on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Sen.Hoc.Virmire]. Shepard will have to kill them both in order to continue exploring the base.
sideEffects: There are many comments in the games by the krogan on how their people are not interested in the arts or sciences, but we see doctors and mechanics and historically, they invented the atomic bomb, so that must just be bluster.

persons.name: Eddie Lang
persons.description: A new C-Sec offier stationed in the Wards, Lang can provide Shepard with some introductory information to the Citadel and his new role as a Spectre.

persons.name: ExoGeni VI
persons.description: Unlike the other VIs in Mass Effect, the [masseffectracker://person?id=O2.ExoGeniVI] was given no name. Once authenticated using [Lizbeth's|masseffectracker://person?id=O1.Lizbeth] credentials, it provides Shepard with valuable information about ExoGeni's experiments on Feros.

persons.name: Fai Dan
persons.description: Leader of the [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope] colony, Fai Dan dies refusing to follow [the Thorian's|megametracker://person?id=E1.Thorian] commands to kill Shepard.

persons.name: Finch
persons.description: An old member of the Tenth Street Reds gang on Earth, which a younger Shepard ran with back on Earth. He threatens to reveal Shepard's shady past unless Shepard secures the release of a fellow gang member, Curt Weisman.
sideEffects: If Shepard completes [megametracker://mission?id=A1.C2.OldFriends] without killing Finch, he sends an email in Game 2 saying the Collectors had taken his family on Freedom's Progress, and he hopes Shepard found those responsible and exacted some revenge.

persons.name: Fredricks
persons.description: A crewmember on the Normandy, Fredricks will boast to Shepard at a bar on the Presidium that he visited [Consort Sha'ira|megametracker://person?id=O1.Shaira], but if pressed will admit it was too expensive, and actually he's never met her.

persons.name: Garoth
persons.description: Garoth is waiting at the [Citadel Tower|megametracker://map?id=G.C1.Tower] to ask the Council for help. He is worried about his brother Willem, captain of the missing MSV Majesty.

persons.name: Gianna Parasini
persons.description: Assistant to [Anoleis|megametracker://person?id=O1.Anoleis] at [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen], Gianna is also an undercover internal affairs investigator.

2.description: Gianna (if she lived through Game 1) has an assignment for Shepard on Illium.

persons.name: Girard
persons.description: Lieutenant Girard asked for Shepard's help to deal with a fellow colonist, [Talitha|megametracker://person?id=O1.Talitha], who was threatening to kill herself in the [Docking Bay|megametracker://map?id=G.C1.DockingBay].

persons.name: Elanos Haliat
persons.description: A pirate whose best days were during the Skyllian Blitz (supported by the Batarians), Haliat is resentful of his lost prestige. He learns of the downed Alliance probe and lays it as bait, planning to detonate it the moment an Alliance team discovers it.
sideEffects: There are several flaws in this character which may indicate he was intended to be turian (eg, he isn't wearing a helmet in a hazardous atmosphere, he refers to humanity as "Shepard's kind").

persons.name: Hana Murakami
persons.description: Hana is working on a control panel on a damaged ship, the Borealis, and refuses Shepard's help when offered. She is actually using the freighter's crane to physically obscure the entrance to the Thorian's lair.

persons.name: Han Olar
persons.description: The only survivor of the initial rachni attack, Olar is extremely traumatized and more than a little bit crazy. He was forced to leave behind a colleague in his escape, and describes her death in terrible detail when asked. At the end of Game 1, he is the only survivor of [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation].
sideEffects: If Shepard meets Olar during [megametracker://mission?id=A1.N.Quarantine], he sends a message in Game 2. He still sounds a little crazy, but suggests that he is in therapy.

persons.name: Harkin
persons.description: During his 20 years in C-Sec, Harkin was known for roughing up suspects in custody, taking bribes, and abusing drugs and alcohol. He was suspended a month before Eden Prime for drinking on the job.

2.name: "Fade" Harkin
2.description: During his 20 years in C-Sec, Harkin was known for roughing up suspects in custody, taking bribes, and abusing drugs and alcohol. Since he was fired, he is working as a racketeer under the alias "Fade."

persons.name: Helena Blake
persons.description: Helena approaches Shepard in the [megametracker://map?id=G.C1.Presidium.Emporium] on the Citadel and asks him to eliminate two of her fellow criminals, purportedly for dealing in Red Sand.

2.description: Helena can be found on Afterlife in Game 2. If she lived through the assault on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.For.Amaranthine] and you persuaded her to disband her gang, she is employed as a social worker, otherwise she is working for Aria.

persons.name: Gavin Hossle
persons.description: Shepard meets Gavin Hossle hiding with the other displaced ExoGeni scientists on the [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.Skyway]. He asks Shepard for some help retrieving prototype weapons data from his console back at the [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ExoGeni].

persons.name: Alestia Iallis
persons.description: A rude and unhelpful researcher in the Quarantine Lab, Iallis is actually a commando serving [Matriarch Benezia|megametracker://person?id=E1.Benezia], working undercover for [Dr. Cohen|megametracker://person?id=O1.Cohen] at [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation].

persons.name: Ian Newstead
persons.description: Ian is wandering around the tunnels under [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope], acting crazy.

persons.name: Ganto Imness
persons.description: Part of [Kirrahe's|megametracker://person?id=P1.Kirrahe] team on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Sen.Hoc.Virmire], Ganto Imness was captured by [Saren|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren], who has been experimenting on the salarian prisoners with Reaper Indoctrination. Ganto was kept as a control subject, now the only salarian prisoner still sane. He can be freed in [megametracker://mission?id=A1.T.VirmirePrisoners.2].

persons.name: Inamorda
persons.description: Brusk and short-tempered, Inamorda will only talk to Shepard if Shepard mentions the shopkeeper [megametracker://person?id=O1.Opold], who is acquiring some questionable good for Inamorda. He may attack Shepard if the deal goes awry.

persons.name: Jacob
persons.description: During exposure to deep space while serving on the [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Gem.Min.MSVWorthington], Jacob suffered brain damage. When the ship doctor attempt to shut down his life support, his girlfriend [megametracker://person?id=O1.Julia] killed everyone aboard.

persons.name: Jahleed
persons.description: Partnered with [megametracker://person?id=O1.Chorban], he is researching the Citadel keepers.

persons.name: Jax
persons.description: A violent arms dealer on the [megametracker://map?id=G.C].

persons.name: Jenna
persons.description: Jenna begins Game 1 working at [megametracker://map?id=G.C1.LowerWards.ChorasDen] as a secret informant for C-Sec. If Shepard helps her out of that situation, she goes back to working at [megametracker://map?id=G.C1.Flux] with her sister [Rita|megametracker://person?id=O1.Rita].

3.description: If Shepard helped Jenna out in [megametracker://mission?id=A1.C1.RitasSister], she uses a trick she learned during her days working for C-Sec to hack the gun of a Cerberus agent and save [Conrad Verner's|megametracker://person?id=P1.Conrad] life.

persons.name: Ethan Jeong
persons.description: The last surviving corporate representative of ExoGeni on Feros, he is desperately trying to salvage the company's interests as the situation deteriorates. He is hiding under the prothean skyway with other survivors, and once communications are restored, ExoGeni directs him to "purge" the whole colony.

persons.name: Julia
persons.description: After her boyfriend [megametracker://person?id=O1.Jacob] fell into a coma on the [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Gem.Min.MSVWorthington], Julia became distraught. When the doctor tried to shut off Jacob's life support, Julia killed everyone aboard. When Shepard boards, she attacks the team and is killed.

persons.name: Juliana Baynham
persons.description: Working on Feros with her daughter [megametracker://person?id=O1.Lizbeth], Juliana, Juliana is hiding under the prothean skyway with the other survivors of the geth attack. She was unaware of the Thorian.

persons.name: Kahoku
persons.description: An Alliance officer who fought with distinction against the batarians during the Skyllian Blitz, Kahoku was at the [megametracker://map?id=G.C] to uncover information regarding the fate of a group of his marines. When Shepard brings him the news that they all died under suspicious circumstances ([UNC: Missing Marines|megametracker://mission?id=A1.U.MissingMarines]), he leaves the Citadel to find the truth. His fate is uncovered in [UNC: Cerberus|megametracker://mission?id=A1.U.Cerberus].

persons.name: Elias Keeler
persons.description: An Alliance diplomat on the [megametracker://map?id=G.C] who uses drugs to get the edge in negotiations.

persons.name: Major Kyle
persons.description: Kyle served at the battle of Torfan (as Shepard's superior, if Shepard is Ruthless). After the trauma of losing so many soldiers, Kyle is discharged and resurfaces later as the head of a biotic cult on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Haw.Cen.Presrop]. It is possible to resolve the matter peacefully, but Kyle could die during the attack when Shepard enters the compound.

persons.name: Ledra
persons.description: A helpful merchant at Zhu's Hope.

persons.name: Lilihierax
persons.description: Also known as "Li," Lilihierax has a lot of gossip to share about Noveria and Port Hanshen.

persons.name: Lizbeth Baynham
persons.description: Currently on probation after protesting one of ExoGeni's more unethical experiments, Lizbeth stayed behind when the other employees evacuated and tried to send a message to Earth about the Thorian. She hid in the basement from the geth and is trying to reach her mother, [megametracker://person?id=O1.Juliana].

persons.name: Manuel
persons.description: An unstable assistant to [megametracker://person?id=O1.Warren] on Eden Prime, Manuel becomes unhinged after the geth attack.

persons.name: Arcelia Silva Martinez
persons.description: Sent by ExoGeni to guard the colonists at [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope], Martinez can describe the tactical situation on Feros, but she is hostile to Shepard.

persons.name: Maeko Matsuo
persons.description: Matsuo was a marine for 10 years, but after coming under fire many times, she left for the largely diplomatic role as head of security at [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen].

persons.name: Mikhailovich
persons.description: A Systems Alliance Admiral in the Fifth Fleet, Mikhailovich commanded the 63rd Scout Flotilla. He was opposed to the construction of the Normandy SR1, considering it a huge waste of the Alliance's money and resources.

persons.name: Mira
persons.description: Disabled during the rachni infestation, Mira controls the research facility at [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.Pea. and [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation]. As more of her systems are restored, she can provide Shepard with more information and aid.

persons.name: Morlan
persons.description: A merchant in the [megametracker://map?id=G.C1.LowerWards], Morlan was playing courier between [megametracker://person?id=P1.Michel] and her blackmailer.
sideEffects: Morlan sends Shepard a spam viagra-style message in Game 2 entitled: "YOUR 2 SMALL!"

persons.name: Nelyna
persons.description: An acolyte of the Consort [Sha'ira|megametracker://person?id=O1.Shaira], Nelyna schedules appointments and also attends to clients the Consort is too busy to see.

persons.name: Alud Ochren
persons.description: Lead programmer of the combat simulator aboard Pinnacle Station (DLC). He leads Shepard through the games there.

persons.name: May O'Connell
persons.description: May O'Connell is in charge of supplying power to the [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope] colony.

persons.name: Opold
persons.description: Opold runs a shop at [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen]. He also smuggles goods, including a package for the krogan bounty hunter [megametracker://person?id=O1.Inamorda].

persons.name: Venari Pallin
persons.description: The turian head of Citadel Security, Pallin assigned [Garrus|megametracker://person?id=S1.Garrus] to investigate [Saren|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren]. He dislikes both Spectres and humans.
sideEffects: There is conflicting information on what happens to Pallin. In Game 3, Bailey says he was forced to kill him during a conspiracy investigation (reflected in the comic *Mass Effect: Inquisition*), but the codex says he was killed by Kai Leng after discovering evidence of the impending Cerberus coup.

persons.name: Palon
persons.description:
Sleeping in the back area of the Med Lab, Dr. Palon can provide more information about the scientists at [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation].

Once Shepard is involved in fighting with any of the guards, Palon and the other civilians refuse to interact with Shepard.

persons.name: Petozi
persons.description:
With a limited store of goods, Petozi operates out of the Med Lab in [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation]. 

Once Shepard is involved in fighting with any of the guards, Petozi and the other civilians refuse to interact with Shepard.

persons.name: Michael Petrovsky
persons.description: Shepard encounters Michael and his sister-in-law [Rebekah|megametracker://person?id=O1.PetrovskyR] on the [megametracker://map?id=id=G.C1.Presidium] after Rebekah's husband Jacob has died, and the two are fighting over whether to use gene therapy on her unborn child.

2.description: Shepard can find the Petrovsky's arguing again over Rebekah's son, on the Zakera Market 26th Floor. Eventually Michael concludes with, "I don't know. Maybe we should ask random people on the street what they think."

3.description: Shepard can find the Petrovsky's arguing yet again over Rebekah's son, in the Presidium Commons.

persons.name: Rebekah Petrovsky
persons.description: Shepard encountered Rebekah and her brother-in-law [Michael|megametracker://person?id=O1.PetrovskyM] on the [megametracker://map?id=id=G.C1.Presidium] after Rebekah's husband, Jacob, died, and the two were fighting over whether to use gene therapy on her unborn child.

2.description: Shepard can find the Petrovsky's arguing again over Rebekah's son, on the Zakera Market 26th Floor. Eventually Michael concludes with, "I don't know. Maybe we should ask random people on the street what they think."

3.description: Shepard can find the Petrovsky's arguing yet again over Rebekah's son, in the Presidium Commons.

persons.name: Powell
persons.description: Powell claims to be a dockworker who was sleeping on the job when [Saren's|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren] forces attacked the [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Exo.Uto.Ede.B], but talking to [megametracker://person?id=O1.Cole] and the other farmers at the Research Camp will inform you that he is really a smuggler.

persons.name: Lorik Qui'in
persons.description: Having uncovered evidence against [Anoleis|megametracker://person?id=O1.Anoleis], Qui'in finds himself barred from his offices on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Noveria]. If Shepard's choices lead to Anoleis being removed from his office, Qui'in assumes the position of Adminstrator of [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen].
sideEffects: If Shepard gives the evidence against Anoleis to Gianna Parasini, Qui'in is promoted to Adminstrator of Port Hanshen, and he sends Shepard a friendly message in Game 2.

persons.name: Rana Thanoptis
persons.description: Rana started her work for [Saren|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren] with her indoctrinated predecessor as her first test subject, so she is hardly an innocent bystander, but she is also very familiar with Indoctrination and terrified of being subjected to it herself. She can provide a great deal of information about Saren's work on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Sen.Hoc.Virmire].

2.description: Rana is a former employee of [megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren]. If she survived Virmire in Game 1, she will appear in Game 2 on Korlus working for Okeer, implanting memories in tank-bred krogan.

3.description: Rana is a former employee of [megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren]. If she survived Virmire in Game 1, she will be mentioned in an ANN report, reportedly having murdered several top asari military officials before killing herself, after displaying signs of Indoctrination.

persons.name: Rentola
persons.description: Second in command to [megametracker://person?id=P1.Kirrahe], Rentola serves as quartermaster on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Sen.Hoc.Virmire].
sideEffects: According to the Shadow Broker's dossier on Mordin Solus in Game 2, Rentola served with Mordin in the mission to spread the modified Genophage strain on Tuchanka.

persons.name: Davin Reynolds
persons.description: Davin Reynolds is in charge of obtaining food for the [Zhu's Hope|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Att.The.Fer.ZhusHope] colony. His wife, Greta, is one of the guards.

persons.name: Rita
persons.description: Rita begins Game 1 worried about her sister, [Jenna|megametracker://person?id=O1.Jenna]. But if Shepard helps Jenna out of her situation, Rita is annoyed having her around, taking the best tips.

persons.name: Doctor Ross
persons.description: Head of the science facility on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Mar.Vos.Nodacrux], she was one of the ExoGeni teams experimenting on Thorian influence.

persons.name: Dr. Saleon / Dr. R. Heart
persons.description: During the original investigation by C-Sec, it was discovered the Dr. Saleon had been using his employees to grow organs for the black market. He escaped before he could be prosecuted, and when Shepard catches up with him, the doctor is again using live subjects to conduct his experiments.

persons.name: Charles Saracino
persons.description: Leader of the anti-alien party Terra Firma, Saracino is seeking a seat in the Alliance parliament at Arcturus Station.

persons.name: Schells
persons.description: Schells developed a machine to cheat at Quasar (an electronic gambling game).
sideEffects: In Game 3, you can see Schells name at the Castle Arcade in the Citadel (DLC).

persons.name: Septimus Oraka
persons.description: An ex-client of the consort [Sha'ira|megametracker://person?id=O1.Shaira], General Septimus began spreading rumors about her, including sharing a compromising secret of the elcor diplomat [Xeltan|megametracker://person?id=O1.Xeltan], and then blaming the consort for revealing it.
sideEffects: If Shepard brings Kaidan and Ashley along in Game 1, Kaidan mocks Septimus for getting so upset over a woman, and then Ashley mocks Kaidan for not understanding women.

If Shepard brings Wrex to talk to Septimus in Game 3, Wrex mocks the turians for ever defeating the krogan under generals like him. Septimus responds "I may be drunk, krogan, but you're ugly. And tomorrow I'll be sober."

3.description: Shepard previously encountered Septimus in Game 1 during [megametracker://mission?id=A1.C1.AsariConsort]. Vosque demands that Shepard kill General Septimus to gain support of the Blue Suns.

persons.name: Sha'ira
persons.description: A gracious and influential asari consort, Sha'ira has a long line of admiring clients waiting for her (expensive) services. She requests Shepard's help dealing with a bitter former client, [Septimus|megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus].
sideEffects: If Shepard helped Sha'ira with Septimus in Game 1, she sends a message in Game 2.
A news report in Game 2 mentions the rumor that Sha'ira may leave the Citadel, due to years of bad press.
One of the Normandy crew can be overheard in Game 2 saying he has an upcoming appointment with Sha'ira.
In the Game 3 Citadel DLC, Sha'ira can be found during the party at the Silver Coast Casino. She confirms that she had left the Citadel to retire, but returned after the Reaper invasion began.

3.description: A gracious and influential asari consort, Sha'ira requested Shepard's help in Game 1 dealing with a bitter former client, [Septimus|megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus].

persons.name: Shiala
persons.description: A follower of [Matriarch Benezia|megametracker://person?id=E1.Benezia], she was used by [Saren|megametracker://person?id=E1.Saren] to interface with [the Thorian|megametracker://person?id=E1.Thorian]. After freed from the Thorian's control by Shepard, she vows to help Zhu's Hope instead.

2.description: Shepard first encountered Shiala during the Feros attack on the Thorian in Game 1. If Shepard did not kill Shiala there, she reappears in Game 2 on Illium, assisting the Zhu's Hope colonists in negotiating with ExoGeni over a medical contract that is hurting them.

3.description: If Shiala survives Game 1, she sends Shepard an email in Game 3 reaffirming her committment to Zhu's Hope. The colony also becomes a War Asset.

persons.name: Simon Atwell
persons.description: One of the human engineers on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Exo.Asg.X57] when it is taken by batarians, Simon manages to escape and accidentally attacks Shepard in an attempt to shut down the fusion torches. But he provides valuable information, and rewards Shepard at the conclusion of the assignment.

persons.name: Sparatus
persons.description: Sparatus holds the turian seat on the Council. If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, he will be replaced by [megametracker://person?id=O2.Quentius], a turian who is actually less antagonistic towards Shepard.

persons.name: Kaira Stirling
persons.description: A security officer at [Port Hanshen|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.PortHanshen]. She is extremely hostile to Shepard and she will die if Shepard chooses to complete [megametracker://mission?id=A1.N.A3].

persons.name: Talitha
persons.description: Batarians killed her family when Talitha was a child, and enslaved her. She was eventually freed by Alliance soldiers who killed the Batarians and liberated their slaves, but Talitha had been under their control for so long that this was extremely traumatic. She tries to kill herself in the [Citadel Docking Bay|megametracker://map?id=G.C1.DockingBay].

persons.name: Yaroslev Tartakovsky
persons.description: Yaroslev assisted Binary Helix in reviving the extinct rachni species from a single egg found in space. He admits that it was a mistake to separate the queen from her children, but says there is no way to correct it now and the rachni must be euthanized via the neutron purge. He is killed by rachni before he can execute the purge himself.

persons.name: Tevos
persons.description: Tevos holds the asari seat on the Council. If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, she will be replaced by [megametracker://person?id=O2.Irissa], an asari much less appreciative of Shepard.

persons.name: Corporal Toombs
persons.description: The only survivor of a thresher maw attack on Akuze (or second survivor if Shepard is Sole Survivor). Toombs claims the attack was engineered by Cerberus and he was subjected to further experiments by Cerberus afterwards. Once he escaped, he sought to kill all the scientists involved in his torture.
sideEffects: If Toombs survives Game 1, he will send a threatening message to Shepard in Game 2.
If Shepard is Sole Survivor, a recording on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Ana.Cronos] confirms Toombs claims that Cerberus was responsible for the attack on Akuze.

persons.name: Valern
persons.description: Valern holds the salarian seat on the Council. If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, he will be replaced by [megametracker://person?id=O2.Esheel], a salarian much less appreciative of Shepard.

persons.name: Rafael Vargas
persons.description: [megametracker://person?id=O1.Calis] was convinced that Binary Helix had stolen data from her company, Armali Council. His "tell" is that he rubs the back of his neck when he becomes uncomfortable.

persons.name: P. Ventralis
persons.description: Found defending [Rift Station|megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Hor.Pax.Nov.RiftStation] from the rachni, Vantralis initially appears helpful, but eventually proves to be another servant of [Benezia|megametracker://person?id=E1.Benezia].

persons.name: Vidinos
persons.description: Head of security aboard [megametracker://map?id=G.Ear.Arg.Pho.PinnacleStation], Vidinos believes turians are far superior to humans. If Shepard can beat his score in the simulations, he will give Shepard his weapon.

persons.name: Vigil
persons.description: Concealed inside a secret prothean scientific facility on [megametracker://map?id=G.Att.Pan.Ref.Ilos], Vigil has spent 50,000 years trying to maintain power to the prothean facility and save what data he could, to share with the next cycle.

persons.name: Warren
persons.description: The head of the archeological team excavating the Prothean beacon, she and her assistant [megametracker://person?id=O1.Manuel] hide when the geth attack.

persons.name: Curt Weisman
persons.description: An old member of the Tenth Street Reds gang on Earth, which a younger Shepard ran with back on Earth, anti-alien Weisman poisoned medical cargo meant for a turian colony that could have caused the deaths of millions.

persons.name: Emily Wong
persons.description: Not to be confused with [al-Jilani|megametracker://person?id=O1.AlJilani], Emily Wong is a friendly investigative journalist covering organized crime and other issues on the Citadel.

2.description: Emily Wong can be seen in newscasts across the Citadel in Game 2. She also sends Shepard an email if [megametracker://mission?id=A1.C1.ReportersRequest] was completed in Game 1.

3.description: Emily Wong does not appear in Game 3. She died battling the Reapers on Earth in the leadup to the game launch. On Twitter. No, srsly: [Twitter: Alliance News Network|https://twitter.com/AllianceNewsNet] (scroll down to **#solcomms** - you can read a chronological version here: [Mass Effect Wikia: Emily Wong's SolComms|https://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Alliance_News_Network/SolComms]).

persons.name: Xeltan
persons.description: Xeltan meets Shepard while trying to file a complaint against the consort [Sha'ira|megametracker://person?id=O1.Shaira]. But as it turns out, [General Septimus|megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus] is the real source of his problem.

persons.name: Zabaleta
persons.description: Now down on his luck, Lieutenant Zabaleta was once assigned to the SSV Einstein with Shepard's mother (if Shepard is Spacer). She asks Shepard to refer him to the Veteran's Affairs Office on the Citadel for help.
